info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 4:12PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Berkshire, east central Rensselaer, southern Bennington and Windham Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 412 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Grafton to Stratton. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Bennington, Bellows Falls, Townshend, Stratton, Williamstown, Pownal, Putney, Wilmington, Stamford, Readsboro, Saxtons River, Westminster, Newfane, West Wardsboro, Windham, Hoosick, Rockingham, North Bennington, Dover and Marlboro. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for western Massachusetts...east central New York...and southern Vermont.
